body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, attorney. Garrard County native. Married to Sallie Grider. Father of Daniel Grider, Rachel Grider, Virginia Bryant Grider. Admitted to the bar around 1810 and became a practicing attorney in Bowling Green. Served in the War of 1812 as a Corporal in Payne's Company of the Kentucky Mounted Volunteer Militia. Member of the Kentucky state house of representatives in 1827 and 1831. Served in the Kentucky state senate 1833-1837. Elected as a Whig to the Twenty-eighth and Twenty-ninth Congresses (March 4, 1843-March 3, 1847). Elected as a Unionist to the Thirty-seventh and Thirty-eighth Congresses and as a Democrat to the Thirty-ninth Congress and served from March 4, 1861, until his death in 1866.
